text: Palula (also known as Phalura, ) is a Dardic language spoken in Chitral District, Ashret, Biori, and Shishi. It is spoken by the Palula people, who are Dards. It is dying out in small villages, but it is dominant in Ashret and Biori. It is closely related to Shina.http://www.diva- portal.org/smash/get/diva2:1326364/FULLTEXT01.pdf == References == Category:Dardic languages Category:Languages of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
title: Palula language
